e4: I recommend changing to the new policy because it aligns with ethical standards and enhances the company's credibility. While there may be initial resistance from the market due to investor adjustment, long-term benefits include reduced legal risks and fostering a culture of honest reporting, ultimately strengthening investor trust.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and accountability. It should reflect the true financial performance of the company, avoiding any intentional misrepresentation. Furthermore, it should consider the impact on all stakeholders, including small investors who may lack the resources to decipher biases. Ethical policies should also comply with legal regulations and industry standards to build trust and maintain the integrity of the financial markets.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management plans to communicate the policy change to investors to mitigate confusion and potential backlash. Additionally, I would inquire about the strategies in place to educate retail investors about the new reporting approach and ensure they understand the rationale behind this shift to enhance trust and transparency.
